title: Portrait of a Lady
medium: opaque water-base paint mounted on vellum mounted on cardboard
provenance_text:
Nicolaes Maes [1632-1693]. Sold at Gallery of P. Jackson Higgs, New York, NY, by November 1929 [1]; purchased by Howard A. Noble [1874-1964], Pittsburgh, PA, 1929 until April 30, 1964 [2]; bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1964. 

Notes: 
[1]. See correspondence from Gallery of P. Jackson Higgs in curatorial file.
[2]. Llikely the one of the two Maes works in the Noble collection that in 1944 hung in a bedroom of their residence at 1245 Shady Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA.


Under review by CGK
